results.title: Baba Yaga: a Russian fairy tale
results.brief_description: Presented as an on-line interactive storybook to read page by page with silhouetted illustrations, this Russian fairy tale tells the story of Vasilissa, her evil stepmother and Baba Yaga, the wicked witch who lives deep in the forest.

results.title: CZ Chromozone
results.brief_description:
The year is 2035. Advances in Bio Technology including human cloning and genetic engineering are leading humanity into a realm of unprecedented physical and mental proliferation. The quest for technological innovation has become an integral part of our evolution as a species.
Chromozone is an interactive work which aims to explore the technologies of cutting edge genetic engineering and internet advancements, as they may appear in the year 2035. It is a virtual world where we as humans can modify the genealogy of our future generations.
It is a satirical work designed to raise awareness and provoke debate about the social and ethical implications of the genetic engineering of our species.

results.title: Beach
results.brief_description: Multi-layered interactive work using both still and moving images of Bells Beach, Point Addis and a beach cave. A beautifully constructed meditative piece accompanied by the sounds of nature.

results.title: Documenting Addicus
results.brief_description: An interactive work featuring the day-today experiences of Addicus, an eccentric and lonely young man, reflected both in moving image and in text through his diary.

results.title: Elsie
results.brief_description:
Combining 2D art with abstract stylised 3D Elsie’s world is immersive and slightly disturbing as the audience receives a taste of walking in her shoes and seeing with her eyes.
Imagination and reality collide as the race to find the parents she ironically avoids from the evil clutches of her neighbours, the Fenwrights, begins.

results.title: Khalid’s surprise
results.brief_description: Machinima is animating using the 3D real-time virtual worlds of computer games as opposed to the complex, non real-time 3D animation software used by professionals. The game engine used to create this compelling short homage to a highly popular film is Battlefield 2, Battlefield 2: Modern Combat features a propaganda-fuelled single player campaign where gamers play both sides of a conflict in one of the most treacherous regions in the world - Kazakhstan

results.title: I thought I knew but I was wrong: New Video Art from Australia
results.brief_description: I thought I knew but I was wrong: New Video Art From Australia is a proposed collaboration between ACMI and Asialink to tour an exhibition of contemporary Australian video art to selected venues throughout Asia in late 2004- early 2005. The exhibition will be curated by Alexie Glass, ACMI and Sarah Tutton, Asialink, and will include the work of a range of artists and filmmakers.

results.title: Exhibition formally known as Synthetics (EFKS)
results.brief_description: An exhibition that charts the history of the electronically generated image in Australia from 1969 - 1988 (roughly). Includes case studies by artists whose creative innovations have influenced significantly the evolution of electronic media arts. (see: Documentation for details)

results.title: When deaf minds travel
results.brief_description: Much is written and discussed about the mental health challenges for the deaf community, but rarely do we hear from those directly dealing with these challenges. This project was produced in partnership with VicDeaf.
